name: solder production, bar, Sn63Pb37, for electronics industry | solder, bar, Sn63Pb37, for electronics industry | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/3883/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of solder bar of the type Sn63Pb37. It is based on information representing current solder materials used in the electronics industry. Data are taken from literature (report from a European research project in the field of lead-free soldering). Infrastructure are based on own assumptions.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of metals at the factory gate.

This dataset includes raw material input, energy consumption and emissions (air), as well as an estimation of the efforts and the infrastructure for the production of solder bar.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/202:Manufacture of other chemical products/2029:Manufacture of other chemical products n.e.c.

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data represent global valid composition data for Pb-containing solder bar, used in the electronics industry.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Typical solder material for the electronics industry production through melting process out of respective metals.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=GLO
A soldering material or a solder is a fusible metal alloy, with a melting point or melting range of 180-190°C (360-370 °F), which is melted to join metallic surfaces, especially in the fields of electronics and plumbing, in a process called soldering. Lead solder: most often, a mixture of 63% tin and 37% lead is used in this case, due to the fact that this mixture has the lowest melting point, a melting point that is close to the above mentioned 180°C. They are the most often used Pb-containing solder in the electronics industry.
